contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "in these nations people will offer incense and pure offerings to me in order to worship me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: in every place incense and pure offerings will be offered in my name

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "people in the other nations honor my name" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: my name will be honored among the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This difficult expression can be translated as "God will take you away with it," that is, with the dung. This expression continues the same metaphor of slaughtering animals for sacrifice, and it can be put in active form. Alternate translation: "they will throw you on the dung pile; God will make sure that they take you away when they remove all the dung" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will take you away with it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "People have done disgusting things in Israel and in Jerusalem" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A disgusting thing has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have certainly cursed you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You are cursed with a curse

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we say that the arrogant are well off" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
